title: Evagoras Paphos
text:
Evagoras Paphos () was a <a href="Cyprus">Cypriot</a> <a href="soccer">football</a> club based in the city of <a href="Paphos">Paphos</a>. Founded in <a href="1961%20in%20football%20%28soccer%29">1961</a>, was playing sometimes in First and sometimes in the Second Division. It has adopted its name from <a href="Evagoras%20Pallikarides">Evagoras Pallikarides</a>, who was a hero from <a href="Paphos%20District">Paphos</a> who was hanged by British Colonists, as he was an <a href="EOKA">EOKA</a> guerrilla, fighting for the freedom of Cyprus. The club's badge was a green shield with the figure of <a href="Evagoras%20Pallikarides">Evagoras Pallikarides</a>'s as a face in a circle.
Dissolved.
In contrast with the other Districts of Cyprus and other major towns, which had permanent teams in First Division, Paphos did not have such a team as the two clubs of the town, Evagoras and <a href="APOP%20Paphos">APOP Paphos</a>, could not remain in First Division for many years. For this reason the two clubs were merged to form <a href="AEP%20Paphos%20F.C.">AEP Paphos F.C.</a> as the people of Paphos wanted a permanent team in First Division.
